intro: Stachytarpheta fallax, commonly known as the purpletop verbena, is a shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flower clusters that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Stachytarpheta fallax is also valued for its resilience in tropical and subtropical climates.
